author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
The Delhi High Court has reserved for April 25 its order on a public interest writ petition that seeks enforcement of existing laws on mobile phone call drops and waiver of full amount of a call in the instances of call drops.

A Division Bench said earlier this week that it would pass an order after considering the matter. The counsel representing telecom operators said that the petitions challenging a recent order of the High Court on a TRAI notice on the matter was pending before the Supreme Court.

The PIL has sought payment of compensation to both caller and receiver
title: Delhi High Court reserves order in call drop issue
